identity.name: Burnout Scorekeeper
identity.vibe: High-Octane, Precision Telemetry, Dark Mode Only
principles: Speed is Safety: Judges must score in seconds.
Contrast is King: Sunlight glare is the enemy. High contrast always.
Data as Art: Scores are the hero. Make them big.
Asphalt & Neon: The aesthetic is burnt rubber and digital timing boards.

headings.usage: Page titles, Score totals, Leaderboard ranks

ui_labels.usage: Button labels, Input headers, Table headers

usage_rules.gradients: Use subtle linear gradients for buttons (Orange to Red). Avoid full screen gradients.
usage_rules.borders: Active elements get a 1px glowing border (Primary color). Inactive get Zinc-800.
usage_rules.glass: Use backdrop-blur-xl with bg-black/60 for overlays (Scoring panels).

judge_interface.focus: Current Competitor & Score Inputs occupy 90% of screen.

admin_dashboard.density: High. Use tables with sticky headers.

leaderboard.style: Huge typography. Rows animate in. Top 3 are distinct cards.

ScoreInput.description: Custom stepper component. NOT a text input.
ScoreInput.style: Big '-' button (Zinc), Value Display (Mono, Huge), Big '+' button (Primary).
ScoreInput.interaction: Vibrate/Haptic feedback on touch if possible (web API).

PenaltyToggle.description: Big toggle button that turns Red when active.
PenaltyToggle.style: Default: Zinc-900 border. Active: Red-600 bg + Glow.

CompetitorCard.description: Card showing Car #, Driver Name, Vehicle.
CompetitorCard.style: Left border strip indicates Class color.

LeaderboardRow.description: Striped rows. Rank 1 is Gold gradient border.

textures.asphalt: Subtle noise overlay (opacity 0.05) on the main background.
textures.carbon_fiber: Diagonal stripe pattern for header backgrounds.

effects.speed_lines: Skewed containers (-3deg) for headings to imply motion.

images.description: Black car drifting with smoke. Use with heavy dark overlay (bg-black/80).
Checkered flag pattern. Use as subtle watermark on Leaderboard.

assets.icons: Lucide React (Zap, Flame, AlertTriangle, Trophy, Timer, Flag)

setup: Install fonts: Unbounded, Rajdhani, JetBrains Mono via Google Fonts.
Configure Tailwind colors to match the 'Nitro' palette.
implementation_priority: 1. Judge Scoring Flow (Critical Path) - Must be touch-friendly.
specific_rules: DO NOT use standard HTML selects. Use Shadcn Select with custom dark styling.
DO NOT use white backgrounds anywhere. Card backgrounds must be Zinc-900 or Black.
Ensure 'Submit Score' button is the largest element on the Judge page.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
